title: Nomilo Fishpond Biogoechemical Analysis
text:
Interactive Code



Throughout this document, hover over the numbered annotations to the right of code chunks to reveal detailed explanations and comments about the code. Where drop-down italicized text is present, expand by pressing on arrow to see code.

title: Nomilo Fishpond Biogoechemical Analysis
text:
Install Packages

```{r}
#| label: install-packages
#| eval: false
install.packages(c("rio", "tidyverse", "janitor", "lubridate", "rmarkdown"))
```

title: Nomilo Fishpond Biogoechemical Analysis
text:
Load Libraries

```{r}
#| label: load-libraries

1library(rio)
2library(tidyverse)
3library(janitor)
4library(lubridate)
5library(rmarkdown)
```


1

For importing excel data

2

For cleaning of data

3

For cleaning variable names

4

For cleaning dates

5

For displaying tables

title: Nomilo Fishpond Biogoechemical Analysis
text:
Get Raw Data File Names

```{bash}
#| label: get-raw-data-file-names
1cd "data/raw"
2ls
```


1

Change directory to “data/raw”

2

List files within directory




~$ksf_compiled_data.xlsx
2024-02-28_ksf-clam-growth.xlsx
2024-02-28_ksf-compiled-data.xlsx
2024-02-28_ksf-oyster-cylinder-growth.xlsx
2024-02-28_profile-data.xlsx
2024-02-28_water-samples.xlsx
2024-02-28_weather-data.xlsx
dfs.RData

title: Nomilo Fishpond Biogoechemical Analysis
text:
Import Raw Data
Define vector of files to import by copying and pasting file names from above:

```{r}
#| label: create-vector-file-paths
files_to_import <- c(
  "data/raw/2024-02-28_ksf-clam-growth.xlsx",
  "data/raw/2024-02-28_ksf-compiled-data.xlsx",
  "data/raw/2024-02-28_ksf-oyster-cylinder-growth.xlsx",
  "data/raw/2024-02-28_profile-data.xlsx",
  "data/raw/2024-02-28_water-samples.xlsx",
  "data/raw/2024-02-28_weather-data.xlsx"
)
```

Use the purrr::map() function to iteratively import all files in the files_to_import vector:

```{r}
#| label: iteratively-import-raw-data
#| messages: false
#| warnings: false
#| eval: false
1dfs <- map(files_to_import, import_list)
save(dfs, file = "data/raw/dfs.RData")
```


1

It takes a while to import these dataframes, so we’re going to only import it once and then export it as a .RData file to load it back in more efficiently




Efficiently load import raw data:

```{r}
#| label: efficiently-load-raw-data
load("data/raw/dfs.RData")
```

Rename datasets:
We will always use snakecase when naming our data objects and functions (e.g., data_object_name or function_name()).

```{r}
#| label: rename-raw-datasets
1names(dfs) <- gsub("data/raw/2024-02-28_|\\.xlsx$|\\.xls$", "", files_to_import)
2names(dfs) <- gsub("-", "_", names(dfs))
3names(dfs)
```


1

Remove prefixes and file extensions

2

Replace hyphens with underscores

3

Check if names were outputted correctly




[1] "ksf_clam_growth"            "ksf_compiled_data"         
[3] "ksf_oyster_cylinder_growth" "profile_data"              
[5] "water_samples"              "weather_data"              


Rename each sheet within each raw dataset to be lowercased and replace spaces with underscores:

```{r}
#| label: rename-sheets-within-each-raw-dataset
dfs <- map(dfs, ~ set_names(.x, gsub(" ", "_", tolower(names(.x)))))
```

title: Nomilo Fishpond Biogoechemical Analysis
text:
Tidy Raw Data

Create Separate Datasets

```{r}
#| label: create-separate-datasets
ksf_clam_growth_data <- dfs$ksf_clam_growth$sheet1
ksf_compiled_data <- dfs$ksf_compiled_data$full_data
ksf_oyster_cylinder_growth_data <- dfs$ksf_oyster_cylinder_growth$sheet1
profile_data <- dfs$profile_data$final_data
water_samples_data <- dfs$water_samples$data_overview
weather_data <- dfs$weather_data$weather_ksf
```



Tidying Processes

ksf_clam_growth_dataksf_compiled_dataksf_oyster_cylinder_growth_dataprofile_datawater_samples_dataweather_data




Steps to clean data
```{r}
#| label: tidy-ksf-clam-growth-data-dataset
#| code-fold: true
#| code-summary: <i>Steps to clean data</i>
ksf_clam_growth_data_tidied <- ksf_clam_growth_data

paged_table(ksf_clam_growth_data_tidied)
```



  







Steps to clean data
```{r}
#| label: tidy-ksf-compiled-data-dataset
#| code-fold: true
#| code-summary: <i>Steps to clean data</i>
ksf_compiled_data_tidied <- ksf_compiled_data %>% 
1  rename_with(~gsub("\\s*\\([^\\)]+\\)", "", .x)) %>%
  janitor::clean_names() %>%
2  rename(date = date_time) %>%
  mutate(date = as.Date(date)) %>%
  filter(date >= as.Date("2023-11-20") & date <= as.Date("2024-02-20")) %>%
  arrange(date) %>%
3  dplyr::select(-c(external_voltage, wk_num, wind_dir,
                   spadd, outdoor_temperature, hourly_rain,
                   solar_radiation, resistivity, battery_capacity,
                   hour, daynum, data_pt, wind_sp, diradd,
                   wind_speed, wind_direction, tide, day, month, year)
                ) %>%
4  dplyr::select(where(~ !anyNA(.))) %>%
5  group_by(date) %>%
  summarise(across(where(is.numeric), \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)))

paged_table(ksf_compiled_data_tidied)
```



1

Clean variable names by removing everything in parentheses, using lowercase and underscores in place of spaces

2

Rename the date_time variable to date, filter to desired date range and sort by date

3

Remove unnecessary variables

4

Remove columns with containing all NA values

5

Group by date and calculate the average of every variable for each day





  







Steps to clean data
```{r}
#| label: tidy-ksf-oyster-cylinder-growth-data-dataset
#| code-fold: true
#| code-summary: <i>Steps to clean data</i>

ksf_oyster_cylinder_growth_data_tidied <- ksf_oyster_cylinder_growth_data

paged_table(ksf_oyster_cylinder_growth_data_tidied)
```



  







Steps to clean data
```{r}
#| label: tidy-profile-data-dataset
#| code-fold: true
#| code-summary: <i>Steps to clean data</i>
profile_data_tidied <- profile_data

paged_table(profile_data_tidied)
```



  







Steps to clean data
```{r}
#| label: tidy-water-samples-data-dataset
#| code-fold: true
#| code-summary: <i>Steps to clean data</i>
water_samples_data_tidied <- water_samples_data

paged_table(water_samples_data_tidied)
```



  







Steps to clean data
```{r}
#| label: tidy-weather-data-dataset
#| code-fold: true
#| code-summary: <i>Steps to clean data</i>
weather_data_tidied <- weather_data

paged_table(weather_data_tidied)
```



  








Export Tidied Datasets
Export tidied data sets to csv into data/tidied folder.

```{r}
#| label: export-tidied-datasets
#| eval: false
write.csv(ksf_compiled_data_tidied, file = "data/tidied/ksf_compiled_data_tidied.csv", row.names = FALSE)
```

Export merged final data set into data/outputs folder.
